clusters.title: Trump administration's defense strategy tells allies to handle their own security
clusters.neutral_headline: Pentagon to offer 'more limited' support to US allies in defence strategy shift

items.title: Trump administration's defense strategy tells allies to handle their own security
items.standfirst: The Pentagon released a priority-shifting National Defense Strategy late Friday that chastised U.S. allies to take control of their own security and reasserted the Trump administration's focus on dominance in the Western Hemisphere above a longtime goal of countering China.
items.content: The Pentagon released a priority-shifting National Defense Strategy late Friday that chastised U.S. allies to take control of their own security and reasserted the Trump administration's focus on dominance in the Western Hemisphere above a longtime goal of countering China.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: Pentagon to offer 'more limited' support to US allies in defence strategy shift
items.standfirst: The US will also offer “more limited” support to US allies, according to a new national defence strategy document.
items.content: The US will also offer “more limited” support to US allies, according to a new national defence strategy document.

items.title: US army says homeland, curbing China priorities; limited support for allies
items.standfirst: A new Pentagon strategy document softens tone on traditional foes, China and Russia.
items.content: A new Pentagon strategy document softens tone on traditional foes, China and Russia.

items.title: Pentagon to reduce its role in deterrence of North Korea
items.standfirst: US policy document suggests South Korea take primary responsibility, as Pentagon prioritises defending US homelandThe Pentagon foresees a “more limited” role in deterring North Korea, with South Korea taking primary responsibility for the task, a Pentagon policy document released on Friday said, in a move likely to raise concern in Seoul.South Korea hosts about 28,500 US troops in combined defence against North Korea’s military threat and Seoul has raised its defence budget by 7.5% for this year. Continue reading...
items.content: US policy document suggests South Korea take primary responsibility, as Pentagon prioritises defending US homelandThe Pentagon foresees a “more limited” role in deterring North Korea, with South Korea taking primary responsibility for the task, a Pentagon policy document released on Friday said, in a move likely to raise concern in Seoul.South Korea hosts about 28,500 US troops in combined defence against North Korea’s military threat and Seoul has raised its defence budget by 7.5% for this year. Continue reading...

items.title: Pentagon shifts focus away from China in new defense strategy
items.standfirst: The previous National Defense Strategy – a document published every four years – identified China as the most significant strategic competitor to the U.S.
items.content: The previous National Defense Strategy – a document published every four years – identified China as the most significant strategic competitor to the U.S.

items.title: US military to prioritise homeland defence, limit support for allies
items.standfirst: The 2026 National Defense Strategy (NDS) released by the Pentagon document on Friday said that the US military will prioritise protecting the homeland and deterring China while providing "more limited" support to allies in Europe and elsewhere.
items.content: The 2026 National Defense Strategy (NDS) released by the Pentagon document on Friday said that the US military will prioritise protecting the homeland and deterring China while providing "more limited" support to allies in Europe and elsewhere.

items.title: US unveils national defence strategy to counter China in Indo-Pacific
items.standfirst: New plan prioritises security in the region and a renewed focus on the western hemisphere
items.content: New plan prioritises security in the region and a renewed focus on the western hemisphere

items.title: US unveils national defence strategy to counter China in Indo-Pacific
items.standfirst: New plan prioritises security in the region and a renewed focus on the western hemisphere
items.content: New plan prioritises security in the region and a renewed focus on the western hemisphere

items.title: China no longer America's top defence priority, Pentagon says
items.standfirst: China is no longer the US Pentagon's top priority, shifting its focus to the homeland and Western Hemisphere, an influential new strategy document says.
items.content: China is no longer the US Pentagon's top priority, shifting its focus to the homeland and Western Hemisphere, an influential new strategy document says.

clusters.title: Thousands in Minneapolis brave bitter cold to protest ICE crackdown
clusters.neutral_headline: Thousands in Minneapolis brave bitter cold to protest ICE crackdown

items.title: Thousands in Minneapolis brave bitter cold to protest ICE crackdown
items.standfirst: Protesters march in icy conditions against Trump administration's anti-immigration policies, demanding ICE leave city.
items.content: Protesters march in icy conditions against Trump administration's anti-immigration policies, demanding ICE leave city.

items.title: Thousands protest Minneapolis immigration crackdown, detention of five-year-old boy
items.standfirst: Thousands of people on Friday protested against the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis amid anger over the detention of a five-year-old immigrant boy. Images of pre-schooler Liam Conejo Ramos being held by immigration officers have rekindled public outrage at Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).
items.content: Thousands of people on Friday protested against the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis amid anger over the detention of a five-year-old immigrant boy. Images of pre-schooler Liam Conejo Ramos being held by immigration officers have rekindled public outrage at Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).

items.title: Hundreds of Minnesota businesses close to protest ICE presence
items.standfirst: Thousands of people have joined widespread protests against the weeks-long immigration crackdown in the state.
items.content: Thousands of people have joined widespread protests against the weeks-long immigration crackdown in the state.

items.title: Hundreds of Minnesota businesses close to protest ICE presence
items.standfirst: Hundreds of businesses in Minnesota shut their doors on Friday and thousands of protesters turned out in the frigid cold as part of an economic protest against the immigration crackdown in the state. The widespread rallies come after organisers encouraged residents to skip work or school and…
items.content: Hundreds of businesses in Minnesota shut their doors on Friday and thousands of protesters turned out in the frigid cold as part of an economic protest against the immigration crackdown in the state. The widespread rallies come after organisers encouraged residents to skip work or school and…

items.title: General strike, rally, marches in Minnesota Friday to protest ICE
items.standfirst: Hundreds of businesses in the Twin Cities were closed Friday to protest the presence of federal immigration agents in Minnesota, as thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis in a show of solidarity.
items.content: Hundreds of businesses in the Twin Cities were closed Friday to protest the presence of federal immigration agents in Minnesota, as thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis in a show of solidarity.

items.title: Minnesotans strike in protest against ICE surge: ‘No work, no school, no shopping’
items.standfirst: Organizers demand ICE leave state and agency be investigated for constitutional violationsTens of thousands of Minnesotans marched in Minneapolis and otherwise participated in an economic blackout on Friday to protest against the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) surge in the state.About 100 clergy members were arrested by police during the action, video footage showed. Continue reading...
items.content: Organizers demand ICE leave state and agency be investigated for constitutional violationsTens of thousands of Minnesotans marched in Minneapolis and otherwise participated in an economic blackout on Friday to protest against the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) surge in the state.About 100 clergy members were arrested by police during the action, video footage showed. Continue reading...

items.title: Minnesotans turn out in the frigid cold to protest Trump's immigration crackdown
items.standfirst: Minnesota residents took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis to protest the federal government's immigration campaign in the state, after weeks of sustained resistance in their communities. Businesses across the region closed in solidarity.
items.content: Minnesota residents took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis to protest the federal government's immigration campaign in the state, after weeks of sustained resistance in their communities. Businesses across the region closed in solidarity.(Image credit: Erin Trieb for NPR)

clusters.title: Russia, UK, Ukraine sit for tense talks in Abu Dhabi
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia launches ‘’ attack on Ukraine as peace talks continue

items.title: Russia, UK, Ukraine sit for tense talks in Abu Dhabi
items.standfirst: US.-mediated talks between Ukraine and Russia resumed on Saturday in Abu Dhabi, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, as part of rare trilateral negotiations aimed at ending the nearly four-year war, which began in the United Arab Emirates on Friday and were set to include senior representatives from Ukraine’s armed forces and military intelligence, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
items.content: US.-mediated talks between Ukraine and Russia resumed on Saturday in Abu Dhabi, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, as part of rare trilateral negotiations aimed at ending the nearly four-year war, which began in the United Arab Emirates on Friday and were set to include senior representatives from Ukraine’s armed forces and military intelligence, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

items.title: US, Russia, Ukraine resume talks in Abu Dhabi
items.standfirst: The ceasefire negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, mediated by the United States and hosted by the United Arab Emirates, have resumed, TASS reported on Saturday.Among those present in Abu Dhabi ar...
items.content: The ceasefire negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, mediated by the United States and hosted by the United Arab Emirates, have resumed, TASS reported on Saturday.Among those present in Abu Dhabi ar...

items.title: Russia launches ‘brutal’ attack on Ukraine as peace talks continue
items.standfirst: Kyiv says Moscow used 396 drones and missiles in ‘another night of Russian terror’ on second day of talks in UAEEurope live – latest updates Russia launched a massive drone and missile attack targeting Ukraine’s two largest cities, Kyiv and Kharkiv, early on Saturday, as US, Ukrainian and Russian negotiators met in the United Arab Emirates for the second day of tripartite peace talks.“Peace efforts? Trilateral meeting in the UAE? Diplomacy? For Ukrainians, this was another night of Russian terror,” Ukraine’s foreign minister, Andriy Sybiha, said after the latest Russian assault on critical infrastructure. Continue reading...
items.content: Kyiv says Moscow used 396 drones and missiles in ‘another night of Russian terror’ on second day of talks in UAEEurope live – latest updates Russia launched a massive drone and missile attack targeting Ukraine’s two largest cities, Kyiv and Kharkiv, early on Saturday, as US, Ukrainian and Russian negotiators met in the United Arab Emirates for the second day of tripartite peace talks.“Peace efforts? Trilateral meeting in the UAE? Diplomacy? For Ukrainians, this was another night of Russian terror,” Ukraine’s foreign minister, Andriy Sybiha, said after the latest Russian assault on critical infrastructure. Continue reading...

items.title: Live: One killed in strikes on Kyiv as Ukraine and Russia hold second day of direct talks in UAE
items.standfirst: Negotiators from Russia, Ukraine and the United States meet in Abu Dhabi on Saturday for the second day of negotiations on a peace plan being pushed by US President Donald Trump. Russia attacked Ukraine's two largest cities ⁠Kyiv and Kharkiv early Saturday, officials said, with one person killed and at least 15 injured. Follow our liveblog for updates.
items.content: Negotiators from Russia, Ukraine and the United States meet in Abu Dhabi on Saturday for the second day of negotiations on a peace plan being pushed by US President Donald Trump. Russia attacked Ukraine's two largest cities ⁠Kyiv and Kharkiv early Saturday, officials said, with one person killed and at least 15 injured. Follow our liveblog for updates.

items.title: Federal prosecutors reportedly blocked from investigating Renee Good’s killing – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.Talks between Russia, Ukraine and the United States have begun in Abu Dhabi, according to the United Arab Emirates’ ministry of foreign affairs.The UAE is hosting a rare set of trilateral talks, bringing together negotiators from Russia, Ukraine, and the US. The talks have started today, and are scheduled to continue over the next two days. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.Talks between Russia, Ukraine and the United States have begun in Abu Dhabi, according to the United Arab Emirates’ ministry of foreign affairs.The UAE is hosting a rare set of trilateral talks, bringing together negotiators from Russia, Ukraine, and the US. The talks have started today, and are scheduled to continue over the next two days. Continue reading...

items.title: US, Ukraine and Russia meet in Abu Dhabi for first trilateral peace talks
items.standfirst: Negotiators representing Russia, Ukraine and the US met Friday in Abu Dhabi for the first direct three-way talks on a plan backed by US President Donald Trump to end the nearly four-year war, with the disputed Donbas region in Ukraine's east remaining the key sticking point.
items.content: Negotiators representing Russia, Ukraine and the US met Friday in Abu Dhabi for the first direct three-way talks on a plan backed by US President Donald Trump to end the nearly four-year war, with the disputed Donbas region in Ukraine's east remaining the key sticking point.

items.title: Could trilateral talks yield a breakthrough in Ukraine-Russia war?
items.standfirst: It's the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.
items.content: It's the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

items.title: Russia and Ukraine hold joint peace talks with U.S. for the first time
items.standfirst: Ukraine and Russia held joint peace talks Friday with the United States, the first trilateral meeting since the Kremlin's full-scale invasion nearly four years ago.
items.content: Ukraine and Russia held joint peace talks Friday with the United States, the first trilateral meeting since the Kremlin's full-scale invasion nearly four years ago.

Prince Harry, who served for nearly a decade in the British Army and served in Afghanistan,…

items.standfirst: European veterans, families of the fallen, and politicians are voicing outrage over Trump's claim NATO allies stayed behind the front lines in Afghanistan.
items.content: European veterans, families of the fallen, and politicians are voicing outrage over Trump's claim NATO allies stayed behind the front lines in Afghanistan.

items.title: U.S. allies condemn Trump's comments about NATO's involvement in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: European military veterans, families of the fallen and politicians have voiced outrage after President Trump claimed the U.S. had "never needed" its NATO allies, and that allied troops had stayed "a little off the front lines" during the 20-year war in Afghanistan. Nancy Cordes has the latest.
items.content: European military veterans, families of the fallen and politicians have voiced outrage after President Trump claimed the U.S. had "never needed" its NATO allies, and that allied troops had stayed "a little off the front lines" during the 20-year war in Afghanistan. Nancy Cordes has the latest.

items.title: Harry says sacrifices by Nato troops in Afghanistan deserve 'respect'
items.standfirst: The US president's comments have been condemned by international allies, including UK veterans and politicians.
items.content: The US president's comments have been condemned by international allies, including UK veterans and politicians.

items.title: Prince Harry says British troops deserve 'respect' after Trump's NATO comments
items.standfirst: Prince Harry, who served in the war in Afghanistan, said the “sacrifices” of British soldiers during the conflict there “deserve to be spoken about truthfully and with respect” — a rebuke of President Donald Trump’s comments about NATO soldiers
items.content: Prince Harry, who served in the war in Afghanistan, said the “sacrifices” of British soldiers during the conflict there “deserve to be spoken about truthfully and with respect” — a rebuke of President Donald Trump’s comments about NATO soldiers

items.title: ‘Insulting and frankly, appalling’: Starmer slams Trump NATO comments
items.standfirst: “I'm not surprised they've caused such hurt to the loved ones of those who were killed or injured,” said U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer, condemning President Trump’s remarks about NATO troops staying away from the front lines while fighting in Afghanistan.
items.content: “I'm not surprised they've caused such hurt to the loved ones of those who were killed or injured,” said U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer, condemning President Trump’s remarks about NATO troops staying away from the front lines while fighting in Afghanistan.

items.title: 'Sacrifices deserve respect': Prince Harry joins PM in criticising Trump's NATO troops remark
items.standfirst: Prince Harry has joined Sir Keir Starmer in criticising false claims by Donald Trump that British and NATO troops were not on the frontline in Afghanistan.
items.content: Prince Harry has joined Sir Keir Starmer in criticising false claims by Donald Trump that British and NATO troops were not on the frontline in Afghanistan.

items.title: Ryan Wedding, Olympic athlete turned alleged drug kingpin, arrested
items.standfirst: Ryan Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian national, was added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list last year.
items.content: Ryan Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian national, was added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list last year.

items.title: FBI arrests former Olympic snowboarder accused of being drug kingpin
items.standfirst: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding, an alleged drug kingpin who's been accused of orchestrating multiple murders, was arrested in Mexico and taken to the United States, Justice Department officials announced. Scott MacFarlane has details.
items.content: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding, an alleged drug kingpin who's been accused of orchestrating multiple murders, was arrested in Mexico and taken to the United States, Justice Department officials announced. Scott MacFarlane has details.

items.title: Alleged drug kingpin and ex-Olympian Ryan Wedding arrested after years on the run
items.standfirst: Wedding, who had been on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list, is accused of running a transnational drug trafficking operation.
items.content: Wedding, who had been on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list, is accused of running a transnational drug trafficking operation.

items.title: FBI arrests ex-Canadian snowboard Olympian turned alleged drug lord
items.standfirst: Prosecutors allege Ryan Wedding, who was arrested in Mexico, behind multibillion-dollar drug trafficking scheme.
items.content: Prosecutors allege Ryan Wedding, who was arrested in Mexico, behind multibillion-dollar drug trafficking scheme.

items.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
items.standfirst: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico
items.content: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)

items.title: Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged cocaine kingpin in US custody
items.standfirst: Ryan Wedding turned himself in at US consulate in Mexico City and is due to appear in court in California on MondayRyan Wedding, the Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin, has been arrested after turning himself in at the US embassy in Mexico, law enforcement officials announced on Friday.Wedding, 44, had been sought by the FBI and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) for his role in overseeing what the US attorney general, Pam Bondi, called the “one of the most prolific and violent drug-trafficking organizations” in the world. Continue reading...
items.content: Ryan Wedding turned himself in at US consulate in Mexico City and is due to appear in court in California on MondayRyan Wedding, the Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin, has been arrested after turning himself in at the US embassy in Mexico, law enforcement officials announced on Friday.Wedding, 44, had been sought by the FBI and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) for his role in overseeing what the US attorney general, Pam Bondi, called the “one of the most prolific and violent drug-trafficking organizations” in the world. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Air France halts service to Dubai, KLM suspends Middle East flights
clusters.neutral_headline: Air France, KLM pause flights to Middle East, including Dubai, Israel

items.title: Air France halts service to Dubai, KLM suspends Middle East flights
items.standfirst: Two European airlines suspended flights to cities in the Middle East on Friday. Air France will temporarily stop service to Dubai and Dutch airline KLM has halted several flights passing over the Middle East. US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that an "armada" was heading toward the Gulf and that Washington was watching Iran closely.
items.content: Two European airlines suspended flights to cities in the Middle East on Friday. Air France will temporarily stop service to Dubai and Dutch airline KLM has halted several flights passing over the Middle East. US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that an "armada" was heading toward the Gulf and that Washington was watching Iran closely.

items.content: Air France and KLM announce pauses as Trump says 'armada' of US warships heading towards Middle East.

items.title: Trump says US ‘armada’ heading to Middle East as Iran death toll put above 5,000
items.standfirst: US president says ‘we have a lot of ships’ going in that direction and that Washington is watching Iran closelyDonald Trump has said an American “armada” is heading towards the Middle East and that the US is monitoring Iran closely, as activists put the death toll from Tehran’s crackdown on protesters at 5,002.Speaking on Air Force One as he returned from the World Economic Forum in Davos overnight, he said: “We have a lot of ships going that direction, just in case. I’d rather not see anything happen, but we’re watching them very closely … we have an armada … heading in that direction, and maybe we won’t have to use it.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president says ‘we have a lot of ships’ going in that direction and that Washington is watching Iran closelyDonald Trump has said an American “armada” is heading towards the Middle East and that the US is monitoring Iran closely, as activists put the death toll from Tehran’s crackdown on protesters at 5,002.Speaking on Air Force One as he returned from the World Economic Forum in Davos overnight, he said: “We have a lot of ships going that direction, just in case. I’d rather not see anything happen, but we’re watching them very closely … we have an armada … heading in that direction, and maybe we won’t have to use it.” Continue reading...

items.content: President Donald Trump said an American "armada" is heading toward Iran, as the death toll from the regime's crackdown on nationwide unrest rose past at least 5,000, activists said

items.title: Trump warns massive ‘armada’ heading toward Iran
items.standfirst: President Trump told reporters that a massive “armada” is heading toward Iran as the country cracks down on nationwide protests. Mass executions and the killing of peaceful protests have been two red lines laid down by Trump in the tensions.
items.content: President Trump told reporters that a massive “armada” is heading toward Iran as the country cracks down on nationwide protests. Mass executions and the killing of peaceful protests have been two red lines laid down by Trump in the tensions.

clusters.title: Major cold front hits the United States
clusters.neutral_headline: Major cold front hits the United States

items.title: Major cold front hits the United States
items.standfirst: US weather forecasters are monitoring an unusually large and intense winter storm that is expected to bring dangerously cold air to more than half of the country through the weekend and into early next week, with tens of millions of people under winter storm warnings stretching from New Mexico to New England, more than 8,000 flights cancelled, widespread power outages anticipated, and weather emergencies declared by at least 14 state governors. Yinka Oyetade reports.
items.content: US weather forecasters are monitoring an unusually large and intense winter storm that is expected to bring dangerously cold air to more than half of the country through the weekend and into early next week, with tens of millions of people under winter storm warnings stretching from New Mexico to New England, more than 8,000 flights cancelled, widespread power outages anticipated, and weather emergencies declared by at least 14 state governors. Yinka Oyetade reports.

items.standfirst: More than 8,000 flights have been cancelled as a severe winter storm is expected to wreak havoc across the US, threatening to knock out power and snarl major roadways. Authorities have issued warnings to roughly 140 million people living in areas from New Mexico to New England.

clusters.title: ‘Massive’ Russian strikes on Ukraine hit negotiation table as well as people, Kyiv says – Europe live

items.title: ‘Massive’ Russian strikes on Ukraine hit negotiation table as well as people, Kyiv says – Europe live
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s foreign minister accuses Vladimir Putin of sabotaging peace talksIndia and Europe hope to strike the “mother of all deals” when EU chiefs meet prime minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi next week, as the two economic behemoths seek to forge closer ties, AFP reports.Facing challenges from China and the United States, India and the European Union have been negotiating a massive free trade pact – and talks, first launched about two decades ago, are nearing the finishing line. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Shift in relations and unpredictability of Donald Trump make it ‘risky to store so much gold in the US’, say experts Germany is facing calls to withdraw its billions of euros’ worth of gold from US vaults, spurred on by the shift in transatlantic relations and the unpredictability of Donald…

items.title: ‘Repatriate the gold’: German economists advise withdrawal from US vaults
items.standfirst: Shift in relations and unpredictability of Donald Trump make it ‘risky to store so much gold in the US’, say expertsGermany is facing calls to withdraw its billions of euros’ worth of gold from US vaults, spurred on by the shift in transatlantic relations and the unpredictability of Donald Trump.Germany holds the world’s second biggest national gold reserves after the US, of which approximately €164bn (£122bn) worth – 1,236 tonnes – is stored in New York. Continue reading...
items.content: Shift in relations and unpredictability of Donald Trump make it ‘risky to store so much gold in the US’, say expertsGermany is facing calls to withdraw its billions of euros’ worth of gold from US vaults, spurred on by the shift in transatlantic relations and the unpredictability of Donald Trump.Germany holds the world’s second biggest national gold reserves after the US, of which approximately €164bn (£122bn) worth – 1,236 tonnes – is stored in New York. items.content: On this episode of Bloomberg Next Africa, we take a closer look at how the continent's gambling industry is evolving. Driven by ...

items.title: Africa’s Betting Boom: Big Money, Bigger Risks | Bloomberg Next Africa
items.standfirst: On this episode of Bloomberg Next Africa, we take a closer look at how the continent's gambling industry is evolving. Driven by rapid digital adoption and a growing sports audience, Africa is emerging as a major betting powerhouse. Global companies like Super Group are betting big on future growth as to governments struggle to keep pace with the regulatory challenges rising alongside them. Bloomberg's Jennifer Zabasajja examine the opportunities and challenges. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: On this episode of Bloomberg Next Africa, we take a closer look at how the continent's gambling industry is evolving. Bloomberg's Jennifer Zabasajja examine the opportunities and challenges. (Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.neutral_headline: Trump withdraws invitation for Canada to join his global ‘board of peace’

items.title: Trump withdraws Canada's invite to his 'Board of Peace'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has withdrawn his invitation for his Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to join his "Board of Peace" after his Davos speech.
items.content: President Donald Trump has withdrawn his invitation for his Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to join his "Board of Peace" after his Davos speech.

items.title: Trump withdraws invitation for Canada to join his global ‘board of peace’
items.standfirst: While leaders of many liberal democracies declined to sign on, Mark Carney had, before Davos, accepted in principleDonald Trump withdrew on Thursday an invitation for Canada to join his “board of peace” initiative aimed at resolving global conflicts.“Please let this Letter serve to represent that the Board of Peace is withdrawing its invitation to you regarding Canada’s joining, what will be, the most prestigious Board of Leaders ever assembled, at any time,” Trump wrote in a Truth Social post directed at the Canadian prime minister, Mark Carney. Continue reading...
items.content: While leaders of many liberal democracies declined to sign on, Mark Carney had, before Davos, accepted in principleDonald Trump withdrew on Thursday an invitation for Canada to join his “board of peace” initiative aimed at resolving global conflicts.“Please let this Letter serve to represent that the Board of Peace is withdrawing its invitation to you regarding Canada’s joining, what will be, the most prestigious Board of Leaders ever assembled, at any time,” Trump wrote in a Truth Social post directed at the Canadian prime minister, Mark Carney. Continue reading...
